subject: Mental Health
title: Cortisol and Adrenaline
description: Learn Cortisol and Adrenaline in one minute.

hook.text: Two chemicals flood your body the moment your brain detects danger.

buildup.text: Adrenaline spikes your heart rate instantly for the immediate response.

discovery.text: Cortisol follows slower, keeping the body on high alert for hours.

twist.text: Chronic anxiety keeps cortisol elevated, which damages memory and immunity.

climax.text: The hormones meant to save your life in minutes can harm you over months.

punchline.text: Stress hormones are lifesavers with an expiry date.

quiz.question: Which hormone provides the immediate fight-or-flight response?
